snippet.title: Horn-Pacquiao rematch firming up
snippet.content:
THE rematch between Queensland world champ Jeff Horn and Manny Pacquiao is firming for November 12 at Suncorp Stadium. The Courier-Mail understands that while the Queensland Government is yet to sign on the dotted line, discussions are well advanced to hold the blockbuster rematch in Brisbane.
Sunday Mail editor Peter Gleeson weighs in on Nicole Kidman wanting the Horn v Pacquiao rematch to be in Sydney, not Brisbane. Courtesy: Today Show
Nicole Kidman says Horn v Pacquiao rematch should be in Sydney Concerns had been raised about the ability of Brisbane to host an outdoor fight in the later months of the year, given the summer heat and the threat of storms. It's understood plans for the fight include bringing air-conditioners in to Suncorp. Pacquiao has a rematch clause in his contract for a return fight at Suncorp in November The much-anticipated rematch comes after an epic July 2 battle, which Horn won in a 12-round points decision in front of 51,000 people. Australia's biggest ever boxing event propelled the Brisbane schoolteacher into international stardom. Originally published as
